main event: Witnesses observed an unidentified aerial object on 7 April 1949 in Charlotte, North Carolina.
interesting points: Witnesses reported a stationary amber cylindrical-shaped object that appeared to be fairly high in the sky.
Local astronomers and observers from various agencies were unable to confirm or provide any information about the reported object.
Investigation revealed that the local observatories had not been in operation for many years and had no records of the reported celestial phenomena.
A witness, a permanent president of the Barnard Astronomical Society, stated that no recognized astrologist had observed any such phenomena or object.
Multiple witnesses concurred that they had observed the unusual object, but were unable to identify or explain it.
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including a postal employee, a farmer, and an amateur astronomer
photographs: no photographs available in the report
